org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateS.name: tiles
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateS.documentation: This tag library provides Tiles tags.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateC.name: org.apache.tiles.template.InsertDefinitionModel
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateC.documentation:
Insert a definition.

Insert a definition with the possibility to override and specify parameters (called attributes). A definition can be seen as a (partially or totally) filled template that can override or complete attribute values. <tiles:insertDefinition> allows to define these attributes and pass them to the inserted jsp page, called template. Attributes are defined using nested tag <tiles:putAttribute> or <tiles:putListAttribute>.

You must specify name tag attribute, for inserting a definition from definitions factory.

Example : 

    <tiles:insertDefinition name=".my.tiles.defininition flush="true">
        <tiles:putAttribute name="title" value="My first page" />
        <tiles:putAttribute name="header" value="/common/header.jsp" />
        <tiles:putAttribute name="footer" value="/common/footer.jsp" />
        <tiles:putAttribute name="menu" value="/basic/menu.jsp" />
        <tiles:putAttribute name="body" value="/basic/helloBody.jsp" />
    </tiles:insertDefinition>

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: definitionName
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The name of the definition to render.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: template
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: If specified, this template will be used instead of the one used by the definition.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: templateType
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The type of the template attribute.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: templateExpression
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The expression to evaluate to get the value of the template.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: role
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: A comma-separated list of roles. If present, the definition will be rendered only if the current user belongs to one of the roles.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: preparer
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The preparer to use to invoke before the definition is rendered. If specified, it overrides the preparer specified in the definition itself.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: flush
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: If true, the response will be flushed after the insert.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: request
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The request.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: modelBody
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The body.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateC.name: org.apache.tiles.template.ImportAttributeModel
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateC.documentation:
Import attribute(s) in specified context.

Import attribute(s) to requested scope. Attribute name and scope are optional. If not specified, all attributes are imported in page scope. Once imported, an attribute can be used as any other beans from jsp contexts.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: name
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The name of the attribute to import. If it is null, all the attributes will be imported.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: scope
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The scope into which the attribute(s) will be imported. If null, the import will go in page scope.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: toName
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The name of the attribute into which the attribute will be imported. To be used in conjunction to name. If null, the value of name will be used.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: ignore
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: If true, if the attribute is not present, the problem will be ignored.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: request
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The request.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateC.name: org.apache.tiles.template.SetCurrentContainerModel
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateC.documentation: Selects a container to be used as the "current" container.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: containerKey
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The key of the container to be used as "current". If null, the default one will be used.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: request
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The request.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateC.name: org.apache.tiles.template.AddListAttributeModel
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateC.documentation:
Declare a list that will be pass as an attribute.

Declare a list that will be pass as an attribute . List elements are added using the tag 'addAttribute' or 'addListAttribute'. This tag can only be used inside 'insertTemplate', 'insertDefinition' or 'definition' tag.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: role
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The comma-separated list of roles that can use the list attribute.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: request
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The request.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: modelBody
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The body.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateC.name: org.apache.tiles.template.GetAsStringModel
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateC.documentation:
Render the value of the specified template attribute to the current Writer

Retrieve the value of the specified template attribute property, and render it to the current Writer as a String. The usual toString() conversions is applied on found value.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: ignore
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: If true, if an exception happens during rendering, of if the attribute is null, the problem will be ignored.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: preparer
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The preparer to invoke before rendering the attribute.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: role
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: A comma-separated list of roles. If present, the attribute will be rendered only if the current user belongs to one of the roles.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: defaultValue
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The default value of the attribute. To use only if the attribute was not computed.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: defaultValueRole
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The default comma-separated list of roles. To use only if the attribute was not computed.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: defaultValueType
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The default type of the attribute. To use only if the attribute was not computed.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: name
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The name of the attribute.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: value
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The attribute to use immediately, if not null.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: request
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The request.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: modelBody
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The body.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateC.name: org.apache.tiles.template.InsertAttributeModel
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateC.documentation:
Inserts the value of an attribute into the page.

This tag can be flexibly used to insert the value of an attribute into a page. As in other usages in Tiles, every attribute can be determined to have a "type", either set explicitly when it was defined, or "computed". If the type is not explicit, then if the attribute value is a valid definition, it will be inserted as such. Otherwise, if it begins with a "/" character, it will be treated as a "template". Finally, if it has not otherwise been assigned a type, it will be treated as a String and included without any special handling.

Example : 

    <tiles:insertAttribute name="body" />

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: ignore
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: If true, if an exception happens during rendering, of if the attribute is null, the problem will be ignored.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: preparer
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The preparer to invoke before rendering the attribute.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: role
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: A comma-separated list of roles. If present, the attribute will be rendered only if the current user belongs to one of the roles.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: defaultValue
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The default value of the attribute. To use only if the attribute was not computed.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: defaultValueRole
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The default comma-separated list of roles. To use only if the attribute was not computed.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: defaultValueType
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The default type of the attribute. To use only if the attribute was not computed.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: name
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The name of the attribute.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: value
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The attribute to use immediately, if not null.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: flush
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: If true, the response will be flushed after the insert.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: request
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The request.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: modelBody
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The body.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateC.name: org.apache.tiles.template.PutAttributeModel
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateC.documentation:
Put an attribute in enclosing attribute container tag.

Enclosing attribute container tag can be :

  • <initContainer>
  • <definition>
  • <insertAttribute>
  • <insertDefinition>
  • <putListAttribute>
(or any other tag which implements the PutAttributeTagParent interface. Exception is thrown if no appropriate tag can be found.

Put tag can have following atributes :

  • name : Name of the attribute
  • value : value to put as attribute
  • type : value type. Possible type are : string (value is used as direct string), template (value is used as a page url to insert), definition (value is used as a definition name to insert), object (value is used as it is)
  • role : Role to check when 'insertAttribute' will be called.

Value can also come from tag body. Tag body is taken into account only if value is not set by one of the tag attributes. In this case Attribute type is "string", unless tag body define another type.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: name
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The name of the attribute to put.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: value
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The value of the attribute. Use this parameter, or expression, or body.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: expression
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The expression to calculate the value from. Use this parameter, or value, or body.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: role
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: A comma-separated list of roles. If present, the attribute will be rendered only if the current user belongs to one of the roles.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: type
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The type (renderer) of the attribute.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: cascade
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: If true the attribute will be cascaded to all nested attributes.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: request
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The request.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: modelBody
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The body.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateC.name: org.apache.tiles.template.DefinitionModel
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateC.documentation:
Create a definition at runtime.

Create a new definition at runtime. Newly created definition will be available across the entire request.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: name
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The name of the definition to create. If not specified, an anonymous definition will be created.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: template
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The template of this definition.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: role
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: A comma-separated list of roles. If present, the definition will be rendered only if the current user belongs to one of the roles.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: extendsParam
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The definition name that this definition extends.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: preparer
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The preparer to use to invoke before the definition is rendered.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: request
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The request.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: modelBody
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The body.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateC.name: org.apache.tiles.template.AddAttributeModel
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateC.documentation:
Add an element to the surrounding list. Equivalent to 'putAttribute', but for list element.

Add an element to the surrounding list. This tag can only be used inside 'putListAttribute' or 'addListAttribute' tags. Value can come from a direct assignment (value="aValue")

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: value
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The value of the attribute. Use this parameter, or expression, or body.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: expression
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The expression to calculate the value from. Use this parameter, or value, or body.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: role
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: A comma-separated list of roles. If present, the attribute will be rendered only if the current user belongs to one of the roles.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: type
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The type (renderer) of the attribute.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: request
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The request.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: modelBody
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The body.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateC.name: org.apache.tiles.template.PutListAttributeModel
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateC.documentation:
Declare a list that will be pass as attribute to tile.

Declare a list that will be pass as attribute to tile. List elements are added using the tags 'addAttribute' or 'addListAttribute'. This tag can only be used inside 'insertTemplate', 'insertDefinition', 'definition' tags.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: name
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The name of the attribute to put.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: role
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: A comma-separated list of roles. If present, the attribute will be rendered only if the current user belongs to one of the roles.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: inherit
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: If true, the list attribute will use, as first elements, the list contained in the list attribute, put with the same name, of the containing definition.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: cascade
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: If true the attribute will be cascaded to all nested attributes.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: request
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The request.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: modelBody
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The body.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateC.name: org.apache.tiles.template.InsertTemplateModel
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateC.documentation:
Insert a template.

Insert a template with the possibility to pass parameters (called attributes). A template can be seen as a procedure that can take parameters or attributes. <tiles:insertTemplate> allows to define these attributes and pass them to the inserted jsp page, called template. Attributes are defined using nested tag <tiles:putAttribute> or <tiles:putListAttribute>.

You must specify template attribute, for inserting a template

Example : 

    <tiles:insertTemplate template="/basic/myLayout.jsp" flush="true">
        <tiles:putAttribute name="title" value="My first page" />
        <tiles:putAttribute name="header" value="/common/header.jsp" />
        <tiles:putAttribute name="footer" value="/common/footer.jsp" />
        <tiles:putAttribute name="menu" value="/basic/menu.jsp" />
        <tiles:putAttribute name="body" value="/basic/helloBody.jsp" />
    </tiles:insertTemplate>

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: template
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The template to render.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: templateType
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The type of the template attribute.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: templateExpression
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The expression to evaluate to get the value of the template.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: role
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: A comma-separated list of roles. If present, the template will be rendered only if the current user belongs to one of the roles.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: preparer
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The preparer to use to invoke before the definition is rendered. If specified, it overrides the preparer specified in the definition itself.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: flush
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: If true, the response will be flushed after the insert.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: request
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The request.

org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.name: modelBody
org.apache.tiles.autotag.model.TemplateP.documentation: The body.
